dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, another stimulus package is, like, sailing through, right? Full of checks for everyone.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, another stimulus package is, like, sailing through, right? Full of checks for everyone.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Congress is readying for a frantic push to come together on a fifth coronavirus stimulus package... The Trump administration has sent mixed messages about its priorities for a fifth package, part of an epic clash occurring in the White House, Fox Business reported this week.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Uh, actually, no. It's kind of a complete mess, if we're being honest.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Uh, actually, no. It's kind of a complete mess, if we're being honest.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Congress is readying for a frantic push to come together on a fifth coronavirus stimulus package... The Trump administration has sent mixed messages about its priorities for a fifth package, part of an epic clash occurring in the White House...

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, shocker. Tell me something new.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, shocker. Tell me something new.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Well, the Trump administration, they're reportedly trying to block billions in federal funding. For testing. And the CDC.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Well, the Trump administration, they're reportedly trying to block billions in federal funding. For testing. And the C D C.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As Congress races to come together on a fifth coronavirus stimulus package with cases skyrocketing across the country, the Trump administration is actively working to block billions of dollars in federal funding for testing and the Centers for Disease Control, according to a new report from the Washington Post.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right, because that's what you do during a pandemic. Block the testing. Makes perfect sense.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, because that's what you do during a pandemic. Block the testing. Makes perfect sense.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and there's, like, whispers of a secret memo from Stephen Miller. He wants to shift those funds to military bio-defense.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and there's, like, whispers of a secret memo from Stephen Miller. He wants to shift those funds to military bio-defense.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Military bio-defense. Sure. That'll help, uh, your average person get a test result in under a week.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Military bio-defense. Sure. That'll help, uh, your average person get a test result in under a week.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! And Congress has, uh, literally 11 days before their August recess to pass anything while cases are just, you know, skyrocketing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! And Congress has, uh, literally eleven days before their August recess to pass anything while cases are just, you know, skyrocketing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Congress is readying for a frantic push to come together on a fifth coronavirus stimulus package with just 11 days to act before lawmakers break for August recess and as the U.S. continues to break records for new daily cases.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, the CDC must be, like, super thrilled about all this support.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, the C D C must be, like, super thrilled about all this support.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Not really. The proposed cuts would slash their budget by 40 percent. They're talking about furloughs, limiting critical research.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Not really. The proposed cuts would slash their budget by forty percent. They're talking about furloughs, limiting critical research.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, come on. Like, what kind of research?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, come on. Like, what kind of research?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Stuff on the long-term neurological effects of the virus, for one. They're even blocking Redfield from testifying.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Stuff on the long-term neurological effects of the virus, for one. They're even blocking Redfield from testifying.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Post report comes as Trump continues to swipe at the CDC: on Friday, the president said he doesnt agree with the CDC director Robert Redfields mask guidance and earlier, the Trump administration stripped the agency of control over coronavirus data and blocked Redfield from testifying to Congress on school reopenings.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right. Keep those inconvenient facts to ourselves, I guess.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right. Keep those inconvenient facts to ourselves, I guess.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: And it gets worse. Pharma companies, uh, they're threatening to scale back vaccine development if testing funds stay in the bill.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it gets worse. Pharma companies, uh, they're threatening to scale back vaccine development if testing funds stay in the bill.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: So, they're basically, like, holding us hostage. Cool, cool, cool.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, they're basically, like, holding us hostage. Cool, cool, cool.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It's absolutely wild. Even Mick Mulvaney, you know, former Chief of Staff, he wrote an op-ed saying we still have a testing problem.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It's absolutely wild. Even Mick Mulvaney, you know, former Chief of Staff, he wrote an op-ed saying we still have a testing problem.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Former White House Chief of Staff Mick Mulvaney penned an op-ed in CNBC this week in which he argued the U.S. still has a testing problem. ... 'I know it isnt popular to talk about in some Republican circles, but we still have a testing problem in this country.'

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, yeah. I mean, what else is new?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, yeah. I mean, what else is new?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: But it matters, though. This is, like, fundamental.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But it matters, though. This is, like, fundamental.
